snippet: The numbers on recyclable plastics indicate the type of polymer involved, letting recycling processors know whether the item is compatible with their recipe.
abstract: Arrow-encircled numbers on recyclable plastics indicate type of polymer, or molecular structure, that makes up that plastic; recycling processors must take characteristics of particular plastic into account when deciding which types they will accept.
lead_paragraph: The numbers on recyclable plastics indicate the type of polymer involved, letting recycling processors know whether the item is compatible with their recipe.

headline.main: Polymers: Why Some Recyclable Items Just Don’t Mix
